Provision.Text: Section 4.79 of the Aeronautics Act prohibits the disclosure of the substance of this Security Measure.
Whereas, pursuant to paragraph 4.72(2)(a) of the Aeronautics Act, an aviation security regulation can be made in relation to the subject matter of the annexed Security Measures;

Whereas, pursuant to paragraph 4.72(2)(b) of that Act, aviation security, the security of any aircraft or aerodrome or other aviation facility or the safety of the public, passengers or crew members would be compromised if the subject matter of the annexed Security Measures were set out in a regulation and the regulation became public;

[Subsection to be cited if the Minister has consulted] And whereas, pursuant to subsection 4.72(5) of that Act, the Minister of Transport has consulted with the persons and organizations that the Minister considers appropriate in the circumstances concerning the annexed Security Measures;

[Subsection to be cited if the Minister has not consulted (urgent). Either this paragraph OR the previous to be used.] And whereas, pursuant to subsection 4.72(6) of that Act, the Minister of Transport is of the opinion that the annexed Security Measures are immediately required for aviation security, the security of any aircraft or aerodrome or other aviation facility or the safety of the public, passengers or crew members;
Therefore, the Minister of Transport, pursuant to subsection 4.72(1) of the Aeronautics Act, makes the annexed Security Measures Respecting ....
